title: Nonuniversality in random criticality
abstract:
We consider $N$ two-dimensional Ising models coupled in presence of quenched
disorder and use scale invariant scattering theory to exactly show the presence
of a line of renormalization group fixed points for any fixed value of $N$
other than 1. We show how this result relates to perturbative studies and sheds
light on numerical simulations. We also observe that the limit $N\to 1$ may be
of interest for the Ising spin glass, and point out potential relevance for
nonuniversality in other contexts of random criticality.
subjects: Condensed Matter/Disordered Systems and Neural Networks
